src:
Pra PON, PBSI Bali Optimis Kalahkan NTB dan NTT
02 Nov 2019, 14:05 by Ni Putu Nirawati


Pra PON, PBSI Bali Optimis Kalahkan NTB dan NTT

KBRN, Denpasar: Pengprov Persatuan Bulutangkis Seluruh Indonesia (PBSI) Bali memberangkatkan 13 pebulutangkis terbaik untuk merebut tiket PON pada babak Pra Kualifikasi yang dilangsungkan di Surabaya 5 hingga 9 November mendatang.
Manajer Tim Bulutangkis Bali Candra Kusuma kepada RRI Sabtu, (2/11/2019) mengaku optimis pebulutangkis Bali mampu lolos menuju Pekan Olahraga Nasional (PON) 2020. 13 atlet yang dikirim itu terdiri dari 8 putra dan 5 putri. Tim putra akan diturunkan dalam lima partai yakni 3 tunggal, 2 ganda, sedangkan putri turun di tiga partai yakni 2 tunggal dan 1 ganda.
“Saya akui persiapan kita latihan bersama memang sangat singkat. Tapi bersyukur anak-anak kita banyak latihan di luar bersama klub besar. Jadi untuk stamina, dan teknik mereka sudah dapat di sana bahkan lebih konsisten, jadi untuk berangkat ke Pra PON kita tidak ada masalah”, ucapnya.
Pria yang juga Wakil Ketua Umum Pengprov PBSI Bali itu mengatakan, peluang lolos mengantongi tiket PON cukup besar, mengingat lawan Bali saat Pra PON nanti hanya Nusa Tenggara Barat (NTB), dan Nusa Tenggara Timur (NTT).
“Target kita lolos, dan berangkat ke Papua. Sepertinya kita pasti bisa lolos karena lawan kita hanya dua propinsi yakni NTB dan NTT”, ungkapnya.
Ditanya nama pebulutangkis unggulan yang paling diandalkan Pengprov PBSI Bali, menurut Candra Kusuma di tim putra Komang Arya Triadnya diharapkan tampil maksimal, terlebih dengan pengalaman atau jam terbangnya di tingkat Nasional tidak diragukan lagi.
Komang Arya beberapa kali juara di Djarum Sirnas. Sementara untuk atlet putri Komang Cahya pebulutangkis asal Singaraja menjadi andalan karena atlet ini intens mengikuti latihan di klub Djarum Kudus, bahkan di tingkat Nasional Komang Cahya menempati rangking 17 dari seluruh pebulutangkis di Tanah Air.
text:
Pre PON, PBSI Bali Optimistic Defeat NTB and NTT
02 Nov 2019, 14:05 by Ni Putu Nirawati


Pre PON, PBSI Bali Optimistic Defeat NTB and NTT

KBRN, Denpasar: Pengprov of the All Indonesia Badminton Association (PBSI) in Bali sent 13 of the best badminton players to win PON tickets in the Pre-Qualification round which took place in Surabaya from 5 to 9 November.
Bali Badminton Team Manager Candra Kusuma told RRI on Saturday (11/02/2019) that he was optimistic that Bali's badminton players could qualify for the 2020 National Sports Week (PON). The 13 athletes sent consisted of 8 sons and 5 women. The men's team will be deployed in five parties namely 3 singles, 2 doubles, while the women will play in three parties namely 2 singles and 1 doubles.
"I admit that our preparation for joint training is indeed very short. But thankful our children exercise a lot outside with a big club. So for stamina, and their technique can be there even more consistently, so to go to Pre PON we have no problem, "he said.
The man who is also the Deputy Chairperson of the Bali PBSI Pengprov said, the opportunity to qualify for pocketing a PON ticket is quite large, considering that the opponents of Bali during the Pre-PON later are only West Nusa Tenggara (NTB), and East Nusa Tenggara (NTT).
"Our target is escaping, and leaving for Papua. It looks like we can definitely escape because our opponents are only two provinces, namely NTB and NTT, "he said.
Asked by the name of the best badminton player that the most reliable Pengprov PBSI Bali, according to Candra Kusuma in the Komang Arya Triad men's team is expected to perform optimally, especially with experience or flying hours at the National level is no doubt.
Komang Arya won several times at the Djarum Sirnas. As for the female athlete Komang Cahya, the badminton player from Singaraja became the mainstay because this athlete intensely took part in training at the Djarum Kudus club, even at the National level Komang Cahya ranked 17th of all badminton players in the country.
